Package oh_hecc.game_parts.passage

Class EditablePassage

java.lang.Object
oh_hecc.game_parts.passage.AbstractPassage
oh_hecc.game_parts.passage.EditablePassage
All Implemented Interfaces:
ModelBitsPassageInterface, PassageEditingInterface, PassageModelEditablePassageInterface, PassageReadingInterface, SharedPassage, UpdatableLinkedUUIDsInterface, Heccable, Parseable
public class EditablePassage extends AbstractPassage implements PassageEditingInterface, PassageReadingInterface, SharedPassage
Like Passage but this time it's actually Editable!

  • Field Details

    • passageUUID

      final UUID passageUUID
      The passageUUID of this particular passage. Yes, it's a UUID. There's a stupidly low chance that multiple passages could have identical UUIDs. but, if you somehow have enough passages so that there's a collision with these, chances are that this would be the least of your concerns. Anywho, they're generated dynamically (never saved in .hecc format or in the final heccin game), so I'm not even going to give you the opportunity to set up a collision.

    • inlinePassageComment

      private String inlinePassageComment
      The comment that's inline with the passage declaration

    • linkedUUIDs

      private final Set<UUID> linkedUUIDs
      The set of UUIDs of the passages that this passage is linked to

    • trailingComment

      private String trailingComment
      The string that's the multiline comment behind this particular passage

    • position

      private final Vector2D position
      The position of this passage

  • Constructor Details

    • EditablePassage

      EditablePassage()
      A no-argument constructor for an editable passage. Only called by the other constructors of this class. Will be given a random UUID as a passageUUID, will be called 'Untitled Passage {that UUID}', and will have content consisting of "Sample Content".

    • EditablePassage

      public EditablePassage​(Vector2D position)
      Will be called by OH-HECC when pressing the new passage button.
      Parameters:
      position - the position for this passage.

      Parameters:
      passageName - the name for this passage

    • EditablePassage

      public EditablePassage​(String passageName, Vector2D parentPosition)
      Will be called when a user creates a link to a passage which doesn't exist yet, creating a passage with that name
      Parameters:
      passageName - the name of the passage to create
      parentPosition - the position of the parent passage that made this one

    • EditablePassage

      public EditablePassage​(String passageName, String unparsedContent, String comment, String lineEndMetadata)
      A constructor for an EditablePassage object read from a .HECC file
      Parameters:
      passageName - the name given to this passage
      unparsedContent - the raw content of this passage
      comment - the trailing comment for this passage
      lineEndMetadata - the metadata at the end of the declaration line

      content - the raw content of this passage

      public void setPassageContent​(String newContent)
      This method will be used when the passage content needs to be updated indirectly. Replaces the passageContent, and updates the linkedPassages appropriately
      Specified by:

      Parameters:

    • sanitizeContent

      private String sanitizeContent​(String content)
      Santizes content by escaping protected HECC characters from it (lines starting with ;; or ::)
      Parameters:
      content - the content to be sanitized
      Returns:
      the content but sanitized.

    • updatePassageStatus

      void updatePassageStatus()
      This method is used to update the 'status' of this passage. If the passage contents are empty, status is EMPTY_CONTENT If the passage contents (still) contains a reference to a deleted passage, this is a 'DELETED_LINK' passage. If the passage contains no links to other notes, this passage is an END_NODE otherwise, it's NORMAL.
      Overrides:
      updatePassageStatus in class AbstractPassage

    • updatePassageContent

      public Map<UUID,​PassageEditingInterface> updatePassageContent​(String newContent, Map<UUID,​PassageEditingInterface> allPassages)
      This method will be used when the passage content needs to be updated directly. Replaces the passageContent, and updates the linkedPassages appropriately
      Specified by:
      updatePassageContent in interface PassageEditingInterface
      Parameters:
      newContent - the new content that the passage now holds
      allPassages - the map of all passages (just in case any new passages need to be added to the map)
      Returns:
      the updated map of all passages

    • resolvePassageLinks

      public Map<UUID,​PassageEditingInterface> resolvePassageLinks​(Map<UUID,​PassageEditingInterface> allPassages)
      Basically handles adding passages to the list of all passages if this passage's content has links to passages which don't actually exist
      Specified by:
      resolvePassageLinks in interface PassageEditingInterface
      Parameters:
      allPassages - the map of all passages
      Returns:
      the map of all passages, updated if necessary (for any links to undeclared passages)

    • renameThisPassage

      public Map<UUID,​PassageEditingInterface> renameThisPassage​(String newName, Map<UUID,​PassageEditingInterface> allPassages) throws InvalidPassageNameException, DuplicatePassageNameException
      This method will be used when attempting to rename this passage.
      Specified by:
      renameThisPassage in interface PassageEditingInterface
      Parameters:
      newName - the new name that the user is trying to give this passage.
      allPassages - the map of all passages. Any passages with links to this passage will have their links updated to point to the new name of this passage, assuming that this passage is successfully renamed.
      Returns:
      the updated copy of allPassages
      Throws:
      InvalidPassageNameException - if the passage name isn't a valid passage name
      DuplicatePassageNameException - if there's already a passage with this name which exists

      private static String getHeccPosition​(Vector2D position)
      Obtains the position Vector2D in .hecc format
      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • getAsStringForDebuggingReasons
